G.T.5524
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 27th AUGUST, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
The British line from the south of the SOMME to ARLEUX, east of VIMY RIDGE, runs as follows :- FONTAINE-LES-CAPPY, BOIS-DE-VACHE (1,500 yards south east of ECLUSIER) VAUX, M0ULIN-DE-FARGNY, (all inclusive), west of HARDECOURT, high ground north of HARDECOURT, TRONES WOOD, DELVILLE WOOD, FLERS, LIGNY-THILLOY, (all inclusive), thence just west of BAPAUME, thence east across the BAPAUME - BEUGHATRE ROAD, thence north east to BEUGNATRE (inclusive) 1,000 yards west of VRAUCOURT, west of ECOUST-ST-MEIN, thence west to CROISILLES, (exclusive), thence north-east to CHERISY, (inclusive), ST.ROBART FACTORY, (inclusive), BOIS-DU-VERT, BOIS-DU-SART, west of PELVES, ROEUX, (doubtful), GREENLAND HILL, (inclusive), GAVRELLE, (inclusive) ARLEUX, (inclusive).
French Front.
The French 1st Army have progressed in the neighbourhood of ROYE and have captured CRAPEAUMESNIL, ROYE, LIANCOURT, and HALLU.
2.ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is no change in the situation.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
27th August, 1918.
Issued at 6.45 p.m.
